Legal_Issue: Failure to inform applicant of missing evidence
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed to have attached a report on St. Vincent's medical care for deaf children; immigration officer stated the report was not received
Decision_Outcome: Application refused due to lack of corroborative evidence
Claimant_Status: Applicant under humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer failed to notify applicant of missing report
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide meaningful opportunity to submit missing evidence
Evidence_Used: Applicant's letter mentioning attachment of report
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness requires informing applicants of missing documents and allowing opportunity to resubmit
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Missing report on medical care for deaf children in St. Vincent
Outcome: Original decision set aside, case remitted for reconsideration by another officer
Harm_Assessment: Applicant denied fair opportunity to support application
Cause_Description: Refusal based on perceived lack of evidence due to unacknowledged missing report
Evidence_Handling: Officer did not confirm receipt or request copy of allegedly missing report
Legal_Provision_Violated: Principles of procedural fairness under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Dispute over whether report was submitted
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of applicant's submission due to missing document not being addressed
Decision_Rationale: Refusal due to lack of corroborative evidence without verifying if evidence could be provided
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to clarify or follow up on potentially submitted evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Correctness standard in judicial review of procedural fairness
